intro: Nototriche gracilens, commonly known as the slender leaf nototriche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its slender leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Nototriche gracilens produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
